If you could start-- you see, we
have learnt more in a lifetime

2892.94.text:
of any of us, any of
you in the audience even

2895.24.text:
if you're 10 years old, the
pace of learning is picking

2897.97.text:
up at the same time, that's
like a race of what's happening

2902.79.text:
in a negative sense, at the
same time we have this positive

2909.01.text:
We have the best chance we
will ever have right now.

2911.61.text:
I call this the sweet
spot in time

2914.56.text:
because of what we
know coincident

2916.97.text:
with the opportunities
that still remain

2919.81.text:
to embrace the natural world
with care and understand

2923.80.text:
that it isn't just because
the barrier reef is beautiful.

2929.24.text:
It's not just because
it's statically pleasing

2931.75.text:
to go a wild forest
and go see koalas munch

2936.36.text:
on eucalyptus in
a natural setting.

2939.51.text:
It's because our
lives depend on it.

2942.86.text:
Our economies depend
on a healthy planet,

2945.26.text:
a planet that works, that
keeps generating oxygen,

2948.17.text:
taking up carbon, holding
the planet steady in a midst

2951.32.text:
of universe of really unfriendly
options, just try to go set

2955.89.text:
up housekeeping on the moon
for 7 billion people or even,

2961.06.text:
even a few people,
it's a big deal.

2964.33.text:
We have to make peace with
this planet and I guess I kind

2969.66.text: of knew that when I was a kid.

2973.21.text:
My parents were somehow
in tune with the natural,

2977.56.text:
they were not scientists
but they respected nature.

2981.57.text:
They both grew up on farms
and I spent my earliest years

2985.71.text: on a small farm in New Jersey.

2988.50.text:
We worked totally
reliant on it for our food

2992.78.text:
but we certainly did
kind of grow a lot

2995.04.text: of the things that we consumed.

2998.20.text:
My father was a natural
engineer and I guess I came

3002.82.text:
to respect something about how
things work, watching him work

3007.28.text:
and how things are put together
in understanding the role

3011.84.text:
of wild things in term-- tht
rain was something you welcome.

3015.90.text:
It wasn't just something
that spoiled your picnics.

3023.90.text:
And I wanted to be a scientist
even before I knew what

3029.28.text:
It's just I love
animals and I love plants

3032.29.text:
and I love being a
part of the world.

3035.61.text:
And I hated it when
I saw, you know,

3043.51.text:
I guess grew up close to the
land and later as a kid going

3048.29.text:
to Florida and my backyard
was the Gulf of Mexico.

3052.81.text:
It's something that
should, you know,

3054.87.text:
kids are increasing detached
from the natural world

3059.39.text:
and my recipe for helping
that is no child left dry.

3070.30.text:
>> And find the child
in yourself.

3072.00.text:
I mean I think I--
it never left me.

3073.83.text:
You know, scientist pretends to
be kids who never quite grow up

3078.13.text:
but you don't have
to be a scientist

3079.77.text: to have that joy to be--

3083.25.text:
Yeah. And looking at the world
with wonder and it's a miracle

3086.93.text:
to be alive and to
enjoy it and respect it.

3096.08.text: I want us to move to questions.

left for question.

3099.99.text:
>> Short answers, short
questions and we'll get to lots

3102.63.text:
of people and we'll start

3108.65.text:
and I appreciate you
reevaluating what I'm going

fish and chips.

3120.82.text:

wanted your opinions

about deep ocean

there's even one

3130.79.text: in Adelaide on those big nets.

>> There's some general

3142.58.text:
and you can use those
as sort of guidelines.

3144.64.text:
Look over 10,000 years of--
about the animals we've chosen

3148.91.text:
to grow out of the, you know,
there are 9,000 kinds of birds

3154.55.text:
or so and we don't eat
eagles or owls, we don't try

3159.53.text: and they live a very long time.

3161.10.text:
We don't raise albatrosses, they
can-- they're as old as we are

3165.17.text: or they can be maybe older.

3167.82.text:
Anyway, so low on
the food chain.

3172.83.text:
Raise things like catfish,
I know tilapia is not

3176.04.text:
in good favour in many
parts of the world but it's

3179.06.text:
like the chicken of
cultivated critters.

3183.01.text:
They grow about as
fast as chickens.

3188.17.text:
They taste like whatever you

3190.54.text:
or onions or lemon, and sort
of like chicken, you know.

3194.91.text:
And so it's a matter of being
smart about what you grow.

3201.60.text: It isn't smart to grow salmon.

3203.88.text:
You'd get these many wild fish
to feed this many farm fish

3210.48.text:
When they say it's four, five to
one, accounting for what it took

3213.35.text:
to make the fish that
you feed the fish.

3215.19.text:
You have to start back at
ground zero, at photosynthesis.

3219.08.text:
To get a pound of tuna,
it's about tens of thousands

3222.37.text:
of pounds of plants to
make one pound of tuna.

3225.97.text:
To make a pound of cow, it's
about 20 pounds of plants.

3230.46.text:
A pound of catfish or
tilapia or carp or a chicken,

3234.59.text:
it's about 2 pounds of
plants so you do the numbers.

3237.95.text:
It's, you know, you have to
decide are we feeding people

3241.80.text:
or is this food security
or is this food choice?

3246.11.text:
Are we looking for a high end
once in a while treat like tuna

3253.69.text:
Those are all, you know, even
though abalone are grazers,

3257.49.text:
it takes about eight years to
make an abalone from an egg.

3260.67.text:
And now I was astonished to find
that abalone are being fed fish.

3268.17.text:
You know, they're--
they feed abalone

3269.74.text:
and these abalone farms
ground up little pellets

3272.20.text:
but taking wild fish to
feed to an herbivore,

3275.64.text:
the way we're grinding up fish
to feed to cows these days.

3279.09.text:
It's really insane, we
got to get this straight.

3283.56.text:
We have to feed people
but we have to be smarter

3288.85.text:
When you take fish
from the ocean,

3290.13.text:
you're depleting our
bank account, if you--

3295.96.text:
We have to think
differently about wild fish.

3298.51.text:
And if we're going to grow
them and I think it's one

3301.84.text:
of the solutions for food
security to take fish

3305.86.text:
that do grow fast, convert
sunlight's energy to plants

3309.10.text:
to protein in a very
short efficient step

3312.70.text:
with more crop per
drop as the say,

3317.89.text:
And so in close systems, not
open systems, close systems

3323.23.text:
where you really, you know,
you account for things.

3326.73.text:
Anyway they're answers, I'm
sorry, taken much too long.

3362.88.text:

3365.09.text:

3368.86.text:

change for the good

3371.81.text:
that you see women-- I mean,
when I first went to see

3377.22.text:
in 1964, captains would

3382.07.text:
of having a woman on board,
bad luck, the ship will sink

3385.65.text: if we have a woman on board.

3387.96.text:
And I was told that once
on a little expedition,

3391.06.text:
that's only when I agreed that
I would do the dishes and help

3395.28.text:
he finally relented
and let me come aboard.

3397.89.text:
Again, not quite so many
men, there's the time

3401.41.text:
when there are 70 to one but I

3407.69.text:
and recognition that
women are just

3412.91.text: and then allowing it to be so.

3415.23.text:

about oceanography et cetera

3444.22.text:
of the best scientists

3458.11.text:
and I guess you could

3462.53.text:
from the University

3464.59.text: so I'm pretty new to game.

I have so many questions
I would love to ask you

3471.89.text:
but I just been sitting
and I'm reading the book,

stung jellyfish and

3481.27.text: that you write the forward for.

what kind of actions can

3511.91.text:

Well, it starts very

you take it to next

3540.92.text:

3542.71.text:
You change the laws,

3545.50.text:
Individual behaviour
counts but it's really great

3548.53.text:
when you can legislate
as some parts

3551.09.text:
of the world who've
decided we're not going

3553.40.text:
to have single use plastic bags

3558.52.text:
to facilitate the

3561.63.text:
, you know, or single

3566.22.text:

3572.80.text:

that question, what

Some are good with numbers,

We want to have a

in your own community,
